overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data. It emphasizes identifying patterns, evaluating multiple methods, and selecting a simple yet effective averaging technique due to data constraints. The analysis thoroughly considers seasonality, data completeness, and practical implementation details while acknowledging potential limitations like missing values and trends.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided dataset
key_insights: Daily seasonality is the dominant pattern requiring explicit modeling
Short data history (96 points) limits complex model applicability
Hourly averaging provides stability when daily patterns are inconsistent
Rounding conventions must match input data precision (3 decimals)
Missing value handling should be incorporated despite absence in current data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed pattern examination and multi-method evaluation, though implementation uses straightforward calculations due to data limitations. Includes statistical considerations and practical data handling.
